doc.title: JIRA

application.doc: JIRA is a software development tool for agile teams to plan, track, and release world-class software. Connecting JIRA issues to the rest of your tools helps break down barriers and unleash the potential of your team.

doc.title: Provide the Issue ID or Key for the issue you wish to edit
Edit Issue Edits an issue. A transition may be applied and issue properties updated as part of the edit.
Do you want to notify users?
Do you want to override the screen security?
Do you want to override the editable flag?
The project ID or project key (case sensitive).
Delete Project Deletes a project. Permissions required: Administer Jira (global permissions)
Whether this project is placed in the Jira recycle bin where it will be available for restoration.
Provide the project ID or Key you want to update1
Update Project Updates the project details of a project.
Get All Project Categories Returns all project categories.
Create Project Category Creates a project category. Permissions required: Administer Jira (global permissions)
name
description
ID of the project category to delete.
Remove Project Category Deletes a project category. Permissions required: Administer Jira (global permissions)
The ID of the task.
Get Task Returns the status of a long-running asynchronous task. When a task has finished, this operation returns the JSON blob applicable to the task.
The ID of the task.
Cancel Task Cancels a task. Permissions required: either of: Administer Jira or Creator of the task.
The X-Atlassian-Token nocheck requirement
Get User Returns a user. Permissions required: Browse users and groups.
The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, *5b10ac8d82e05b22cc7d4ef5*. Required.

Use expand to include additional information about users in the response. This parameter accepts a comma-separated list. Expand options include: * `groups` includes all groups and nested groups to which the user belongs. * `applicationRoles` includes details of all the applications to which the user has access.
Create a new issue This operation is used to create a new issue.
Pick a project to create the issue in.
Create a new issue (V2) This operation is used to create a new issue.
Pick a project to create the issue in.
Pick an issue type.
Unique Key of the issue.
Get issue by key This operation is used to retrieve the issue object for a given issue Key.
Unique Key of the issue to add a comment to.
Add comment This operation is used to add a comment to an existing JIRA issue.
Get projects This operation is used to retrieve a list of projects for your JIRA instance.
Create a new project This operation is used to create a new JIRA project.
Get projects This operation is used to retrieve a list of projects for your JIRA instance.
List users by project This operation is used to retrieve a list of all users associated with a project.
Unique key of the project.
